author: Odeinoichus
title: Martian Scooting Along
review:
Set #7303 Jet Scooter: This is the best out of the entire bunch. The Jet Scooter succeeds in looking like a great model, it is an open air vessel used by the Martians to travel across their home planet... Or at least that's how I saw it.

 

This build is decent enough, this is the set to get for the bulk of the MOCing needs when combining 7300 - 7303. Mainly because I think it has the most pieces. As a stand alone model it's also nicer than some of the others from the Impulse range, as I may have mentioned before.

 

The Martian Mini-Figures are actually kind of interesting. Take the Battle Droid torso, arms and legs, hit them with a rainbow blaster of some kind and stick on a new round looking alien head and you've got a Martian. It's a nice use of LEGO Star Wars pieces in a different theme for Mini-Figures. I think everyone's Space collection could use a few Life on Mars Mini-Figures, they are definitely better than the Mars Missions Alien Mini-Figures. At least these ones can move their limbs.

 

So if you're looking to get one of the impulse sets I'd say this one is your best bet. I recommend this one, but keep in mind that this set is still an impulse set and uses a limited number of pieces to make the model. So prepare to do a little bit of MOCing with it.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Space (Life On Mars) - Jet Scooter
review:
The Jet Scooter (7303) is a LEGO Space (Life On Mars) set which came out in 2001. It comes with 1 minifig and 24 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7303-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Alien: The alien is comes with an orange battle droid torso and turquoise battle droid arms. The legs are black and his turquoise head has some nice markings on it.

Jet Scooter:

The jet scooter is very simple to build and looks very cool. On the front you can see two headlights which sviwel and on the back you can see two engines. The joystick does sviwel too. I think it would also make a great speeder bike for LEGO Star Wars brickfilms or MOC's.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Very sturdy
Nice starter set
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features


All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
